Table of Contents

Class AppArray

Namespace
Booseapp
Assembly
Booseapp.dll

Represents an application-defined array variable/command that can store either integer or real values. This class acts as both the "array" declaration command and the stored variable instance in the program.

public class AppArray : Evaluation, ICommand

Properties

Cols

Gets the number of columns in the array (defaults to 1 for 1D arrays).

public int Cols { get; }

Property Value

int

ElementType

Gets the element type of the array ("int" or "real").

public string ElementType { get; }

Property Value

string

Rows

Gets the number of rows in the array.

public int Rows { get; }

Property Value

int

Value

Gets or sets the scalar value for this evaluation. Arrays do not have a single scalar value, so this property is not used.

public override int Value { get; set; }

Property Value

int

Methods

BoundsCheck(int, int)

Validates that the provided row and column indices are within bounds.

public void BoundsCheck(int r, int c)

Parameters

r int

The zero-based row index.

c int

The zero-based column index.

Exceptions

CommandException

Thrown when the indices are out of bounds.

Compile()

Compiles the array declaration by registering the variable in the program and allocating storage.

public override void Compile()

Exceptions

CommandException

Thrown if a variable with the same name already exists.

Execute()

Executes the array declaration. No runtime action is required after compilation.

public override void Execute()

PeekInt(int, int)

Retrieves an integer value from the specified position.

public int PeekInt(int r, int c)

Parameters

r int

The zero-based row index.

c int

The zero-based column index.

Returns

int

The integer value stored at the given indices.

Exceptions

CommandException

Thrown if the array element type is not integer or the indices are out of bounds.

PeekReal(int, int)

Retrieves a real (double) value from the specified position.

public double PeekReal(int r, int c)

Parameters

r int

The zero-based row index.

c int

The zero-based column index.

Returns

double

The real value stored at the given indices.

Exceptions

CommandException

Thrown if the array element type is not real or the indices are out of bounds.

PokeInt(int, int, int)

Stores an integer value at the specified position.

public void PokeInt(int r, int c, int v)

Parameters

r int

The zero-based row index.

c int

The zero-based column index.

v int

The integer value to store.

Exceptions

CommandException

Thrown if the array element type is not integer or the indices are out of bounds.

PokeReal(int, int, double)

Stores a real (double) value at the specified position.

public void PokeReal(int r, int c, double v)

Parameters

r int

The zero-based row index.

c int

The zero-based column index.

v double

The real value to store.

Exceptions

CommandException

Thrown if the array element type is not real or the indices are out of bounds.

Set(StoredProgram, string)

Sets the command parameters for the array declaration. Expected formats: int name rows or int name rows cols (commas are permitted between dimensions).

public override void Set(StoredProgram program, string param)

Parameters

program StoredProgram

The stored program that owns this variable/command.

param string

The raw parameter string following the "array" keyword.

Exceptions

CommandException

Thrown when the syntax is invalid, the type is not supported, or the dimensions are not positive integers.
